content: On August 5, 1991, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the San Diego Padres in a thrilling game that showcased the brilliance of pitcher Tom Glavine. Glavine pitched a complete game shutout, leading the Braves to a 3-0 victory. This performance was part of Glavine's standout season, which ultimately helped the Braves secure their first division title since moving to Atlanta and set the stage for their memorable run to the World Series later that year.
